title: What makes band names like Fall Out Boy and Queen good? - Quora

response.answer_text: A2A I think that, perhaps, when the band is good, the name becomes good… whether it was a good name or not. I think Fall Out Boy is a proper stupid name (same with My Chemical Romance); but then, I've never had a very high opinion of either. Queen could have been a silly name; REM and U2 could have been ludicrous names; hell, The Beatles could have had an idiotic homophone of a name… but these bands were so iconic that we began to associate the superiority of music with the names. In fact, I don't believe I can think of one band whose music is shit but they somehow have a really cool band name.
That's up to the band's personal preference. Queen used the name to reference Royalty toward the British Government. But it wasn't the name but more of the music that makes them great.
